newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Dana Petroleum pleased with Russian progress.
newsitem.headline: Dana Petroleum pleased with Russian progress.

text.p: Irish-based oil firm Dana Petroleum Plc said on Tuesday it was pleased with progress at its Russian subsidiary YoganOil.
"We have been encouraged by operational progress during 1997," chief executive Tom Cross said in a statement.
"First-quarter exports have been in line with expectations and we were particularly pleased to receive the revenue from the first export sale within one month.
Dana said YoganOil had exported more than 90,000 barrels of oil in the first quarter of 1997, its first export sales from its Vat-Yoganskoye field in Siberia.
Of the 90,000 barrels exported, 73,000 were allocated to Lithuania and the rest to Germany. YoganOil also sold a further 73,000 barrels domestically, Dana said.
YoganOil is 60-percent owned by Dana and Dana's holding will rise to 80 percent by the end of the month at the settlement of an option exercised in April.
"Dana's acquisitive programme has consolidated our control over YoganOil and will provide Dana with greater revenues as the oil production builds over the next three years," Cross said.
